questions.text: This coastal city is in Queensland, north of the Tropic of Capricorn.  What is its name?
questions.explanation:
Cairns.

	Cairns was declared a town in 1876 and was named after the then Governor of Queensland.  Cairns has five sister cities around the world, in 2003, including, Lae in Papua New Guinea, Sidney in Canada, Scottsdale in the US, Riga in Latvia and Hiwasa in Japan.  Currumbin is at the southern end of the Gold Coast, Charters Towers and Clermont are inland towns, all in Queensland!

questions.text: Where in the world is the city of Cartago?
questions.explanation:
Costa Rica.

	Cartago, the capital of Cartago Province in central Costa Rica, was founded in 1563.  Destroyed by a volcano erupting in 1723 it suffered further damage from earthquakes, twice in the 1800's and again in 1910!

questions.text: In which country of the northern hemisphere is the city of Cranbrook?
questions.explanation:
Canada.

	Cranbrook was declared in 1898 after the advent of the railway!  Located in British Columbia it is overlooked by the 'Rockies' which have dense forests and blue water lakes.

questions.text: Which of the following cities is located on the Gulf of Mexico?
questions.explanation:
Campeche.

	Campeche was originally called Villa and Puerto de San Francisco de Campeche which was changed in 1777, to Campeche City.  A target for pirates in the 1800's it became a 'fort' city.  Córdoba is a city in both Mexico (not on the Gulf) and Argentina; Calcutta is a city in India; and, Cayenne is a city in French Guiana.

questions.text: What is the name of this industrial city located in Romania, to the west of Bucharest?
questions.explanation:
Craiova.

	Craiova, on the Jiu River, is the administrative centre of Dolj County and the historical capital of the Oltenia Region.  Built on an ancient Roman site it was destroyed by earthquake in 1790 and razed by the Turks in 1802!  Constanta is a coastal city on the Black Sea; Cluj-Napoca is in the north, in Transylvania and is the historical capital of the Province; and, Crisana is an historical region in the north west, between Transylvania and Hungary!

questions.text: A city in Equatorial Guinea is which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Cogo.

	The Republic of Equatorial Guinea is a  densely forested country with substantial oil resources. Coahuila is a Mexican state; Corozol is a city in Belize; and, Coimbra is a city in Portugal.

questions.text: The largest city and unofficial capital of Benin is which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Cotonou.

	The Republic of Benin has a population of over six million people with over forty ethnic groups!  The official language is French and the main religion is Animism or Voodoo!  Corum is a city in Turkey; Cairo is the capital of Egypt; and, Canton (Guangzhou) is in China.

questions.text: Which of the following Indian cities is the capital of the Punjab?
questions.explanation:
Chandigarh.

	Chandernagore is in the state of West Bengal, 35km north of Calcutta; Conjeeveram is in the south of India, in Madras; and, the Coromandel Coast was the former name of the east coast of India, namely the western shore of the Bay of Bengal.

questions.text: What is the name of the capital city of St Lucia?
questions.explanation:
Castries.

	St Lucia is in the eastern Caribbean, south of Martinique.  It was a British territory, given home rule in 1967 and full independence in 1979.  Caracas is the capital of Venezuela; Canberra is the capital of Australia; and, Conakry is the capital of Guinea.

questions.text: Of the following, which is a Spanish seaside city?
questions.explanation:
Cadiz.

	Calais is a French seaport; Cali is a city in south west Colombia; and, Callao is a fishing port in Peru, south west of Lima.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a city in the United Kingdom?
questions.explanation:
Carlow.

	Carlow is a County in the Republic of Ireland!

questions.text: An industrial city in Colombia is which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Cartagena.

	Cartagena is a port city in north west Colombia.  Carthage was an ancient city on the north west coast of Africa; The Cayo District, with the major city Cayo, is in the central west of Belize; and, Cebu is a city in the Philippines.

questions.text: In the south of Peru is which of the following cities?
questions.explanation:
Cuzco.

	Cuzco is a city in the south of Peru and was the capital of the Inca empire; Curityba is the capital of the State of Parana in Brazil; Curacao is an island in the Caribbean; and, Cumbria is a county in the north west of England.

questions.text: Do you know which of the following is an Italian city?
questions.explanation:
Cuma.

	Cumae is on the Italian coast, 16km west of Naples; Cuenca is the capital of the Province of New Castile in Spain; Ctesiphon 'the lost city of Persia' is today only a ruin, south east of Baghdad; and, Cromarty is a Scottish port and naval base.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a city in China?
questions.explanation:
Chekiang.

	Chekiang is a Province in China; Chongqing is a city in Sichuan Province; Chengdu is an ancient city and capital of Sichuan Province; and, Chefoo is a port in Shantung Province, China.
